bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 103 (Tuesday, June 18, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. MOYLAN:H.R. 8786.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1The single subject of this legislation is;To allow certain foreign air carriers to stop in Guam orthe Northern Mariana Islands in the course of transportationof passengers or cargo in either direction between a place inthe United States and a place outside the United States, andfor other purposes.[Page H4115]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

item.fullName: Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

bill.title: PIFAA

item.title: Pacific Island Flight Alternatives Act of 2024

To allow certain foreign air carriers to stop in Guam or the Northern Mariana Islands in the course of transportation of passengers or cargo in either direction between a place in the United States and a place outside the United States, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
